docs.title: What is fxgui
docs.text:
A custom logging module for Python that supports colorized output and log file rotation.

Note

This documentation is updated regularly to reflect the most recent changes. If you spot any issue or have a feature request, don't hesitate to send me an email.

docs.title: fxlogger
docs.text:
Custom logging module enabling color and log file rotation.

Warning

Enabling save_to_file requires calling set_log_directory before creating a logger. This can be done once inside __init__.py.

Examples:

>>> import logging
>>> from fxlog import fxlogger
>>> _logger = fxlogger.configure_logger(__name__, save_to_file=True)
>>> _logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
>>> _logger.debug("This is a debug message")
>>>
>>> # With custom message color per log call
>>> _logger.debug("This message will be blue", color=fxlogger.BLUE)
>>> _logger.info("This message will be red", color=fxlogger.RED)
>>> _logger.warning("Bright yellow warning", color=fxlogger.YELLOW + fxlogger.BRIGHT)

Classes:

Name Description FXColorLogger

Custom logger class that supports color parameter in log methods.

FXFormatter

Custom log formatter that adds color to log messages based on the

FXTimedRotatingFileHandler

Custom log file handler that rotates log files at midnight.

Functions:

Name Description clear_logs

Delete all the log files.

configure_logger

Creates a custom logger with the specified name and returns it.

delete_old_logs

Deletes log files older than the specified number of days.

set_log_directory

Sets the log directory for the module.

set_loggers_level

Sets the logging level for all loggers created with configure_logger.

docs.title: FXColorLogger
docs.text:
Bases: Logger

Custom logger class that supports color parameter in log methods.

Methods:

Name Description critical

Log a message with severity 'CRITICAL' on this logger.

debug

Log a message with severity 'DEBUG' on this logger.

error

Log a message with severity 'ERROR' on this logger.

info

Log a message with severity 'INFO' on this logger.

warning

Log a message with severity 'WARNING' on this logger.

critical(msg, *args, color=None, **kwargs)

Log a message with severity 'CRITICAL' on this logger.

docs.title: FXFormatter
docs.text:
Bases: Formatter

Custom log formatter that adds color to log messages based on the log level.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default str

The log message format string.

None str

The date format string.

None str

The format style.

'{' bool

Whether to enable color logging. Note that if enabled but unsupported, color logging will be disabled. Defaults to False.

False bool

Whether to enable a separator between log messages. Defaults to False.

False

Attributes:

Name Type Description level_colors

A dictionary mapping log levels to their respective color codes.

enable_color

Whether to enable color logging.

enable_separator

Whether to enable a separator between log messages.

docs.title: FXTimedRotatingFileHandler
docs.text:
Bases: TimedRotatingFileHandler

Custom log file handler that rotates log files at midnight.

Attributes:

Name Type Description suffix str

The suffix to append to the rotated log file.

docs.title: configure_logger
docs.text:
configure_logger(
    logger_name: str,
    enable_color: bool = True,
    enable_separator: bool = True,
    save_to_file: bool = True,
) -> FXColorLogger

Creates a custom logger with the specified name and returns it.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default str

The name of the logger.

required bool

Whether to enable color logging. Defaults to True.

True bool

Whether to enable a separator between log messages. Defaults to True.

True bool

Whether to save logs to a file. Defaults to True.

True

Returns:

Name Type Description FXColorLogger FXColorLogger

The custom logger that supports color parameter.

docs.title: delete_old_logs
docs.text:
delete_old_logs(days: int) -> None

Deletes log files older than the specified number of days.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default int

The number of days after which log files should be deleted.

required

docs.title: set_log_directory
docs.text:
set_log_directory(log_directory: Union[str, Path]) -> None

Sets the log directory for the module.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default Union[str, Path]

The directory to save the log files.

required Notes

This function must be called before saving logs to a file, and can only be called once.

docs.title: set_loggers_level
docs.text:
set_loggers_level(level: int) -> None

Sets the logging level for all loggers created with configure_logger. This affects both existing loggers and any loggers created after this call.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default int

The logging level to set (e.g., fxlogger.DEBUG, fxlogger.INFO).

required

Examples:

>>> from fxlog import fxlogger
>>> fxlogger.set_loggers_level(fxlogger.DEBUG)

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
The package is available on PyPI.

pip install fxlog
